item.title: Israel receives two bodies Hamas says are dead hostages
item.description: Two coffins were handed over by Hamas to the Israeli military via the Red Cross in Gaza on Tuesday.

item.title: Colombian court overturns former president's conviction
item.description: Alvaro Uribe was the country's first president to be criminally convicted, and faced 12 years' house arrest.

item.title: Watch: Dozens of giant pumpkins hit the water for rowing race
item.description: The 'squashbucklers' climbed into their hollowed out giant gourds, which are grown locally in the US state of Oregon.

item.title: Stolen Louvre jewellery worth â‚¬88m, prosecutor says
item.description: The historic items were taken in broad daylight and are now feared to have been broken down for parts.

item.title: Ukrainian city in total blackout after 'massive' Russian assault
item.description: Across the wider region, four people are reported to have been killed and 10 others injured.
